features.name: Data Import & Export Tools
features.content: Based on 31 Dynamics 365 Marketing reviews. Ability to input, modify and extract data from the application in bulk through a structured file.

features.name: Integration APIs
features.content: Application Programming Interface - Specification for how the application communicates with other software.  API's typically enable integration of data, logic, objects, etc with other software applications. 30 reviewers of Dynamics 365 Marketing have provided feedback on this feature.

features.name: Breadth of Partner Applications
features.content: To what extent are there partner applications readily available for integrating into this product?  Partner applications typically provide complementary, best of breed functionality not offered natively in this product. 30 reviewers of Dynamics 365 Marketing have provided feedback on this feature.

features.name: Customization
features.content: Based on 29 Dynamics 365 Marketing reviews. System provides sufficient customization to meet business requirements

features.name: Workflow Capability
features.content: Based on 27 Dynamics 365 Marketing reviews. Automates a process that requires a series of steps that typically require intervention by a several different users.  Administrators can write rules to determine who and when a user needs to complete a step.  Also includes notification of users when they need to take action.

features.name: User, Role, and Access Management
features.content: As reported in 28 Dynamics 365 Marketing reviews. Grant access to select data, features, objects, etc. based on the users, user role, groups, etc.

features.name: Internationalization
features.content: Enables users to view and transact business with the same content in multiple languages and currencies. 28 reviewers of Dynamics 365 Marketing have provided feedback on this feature.

features.name: Sandbox / Test Environments
features.content: Allows administrators to easily develop and test changes to the CRM deployment.  After changes are made admins can easily migrate the changes into the "live" or "production" environment.  This feature was mentioned in 28 Dynamics 365 Marketing reviews.

features.name: Performance and Reliability
features.content: Software is consistently available (uptime) and allows users to complete tasks quickly because they are not waiting for the software to respond to an action they took.  This feature was mentioned in 28 Dynamics 365 Marketing reviews.

features.name: Output Document Generation
features.content: Allows adminstrators to create templates that enable users to quickly generate dynamic documents in various formats based on the data stored in the application. 28 reviewers of Dynamics 365 Marketing have provided feedback on this feature.

features.name: Building and Personalizing Emails
features.content: As reported in 44 Dynamics 365 Marketing reviews. Create and design emails with an editor; manage templates; personalize dynamically

features.name: Sending Outbound Emails
features.content: Create targeted lists, schedule and manage bulk email sending. 44 reviewers of Dynamics 365 Marketing have provided feedback on this feature.

features.name: Manage Email Deliverability

features.name: Automated Email Responses
features.content: As reported in 42 Dynamics 365 Marketing reviews. Set up automated nurturing emails based on events, online activities, and lead scores

features.name: Landing Pages and Forms

features.name: Dynamic Content

features.name: A/B Testing

features.name: Marketing Lead Database

Includes a view of all marketing interactions between each prospect and your company, including website visits, email clicks, scoring changes, and data updates/history.

features.name: Data Quality Management
features.content: Based on 42 Dynamics 365 Marketing reviews. Data quality consists of deduplication, cleansing, and appending your marketing database.

features.name: Segmentation
features.content: As reported in 44 Dynamics 365 Marketing reviews. Segment your database and build list of target leads and contacts.  Filter on demographic and company attributes (title, company size, location) as well as behavioral filters and CRM information.

features.name: Lead Scoring and Grading
features.content: Based on 43 Dynamics 365 Marketing reviews. Automatically qualify and score leads based on demographics as well as prospect online behaviors, including recency and frequency. Assign your own weights to determine lead scores for prioritization.

features.name: Lead Nurturing
features.content: Automate drip marketing campaigns that send relevant messages over time, based on prospect behaviors and pre-defined campaign steps. 42 reviewers of Dynamics 365 Marketing have provided feedback on this feature.

features.name: Online Behavior Tracking
features.content: Based on 41 Dynamics 365 Marketing reviews. Track which emails a prospect opens and clicks, what web-pages they visit, what keywords they use, even what they say on social networks.

features.name: Automated Alerts and Tasks
features.content: As reported in 43 Dynamics 365 Marketing reviews. Create tasks automatically and provide real-time sales alerts over email, RSS or mobile device.

features.name: CRM Lead Integration
features.content: Sync lead, contact, account, and opportunity information with your CRM system. 43 reviewers of Dynamics 365 Marketing have provided feedback on this feature.

features.content: Manage marketing campaigns and programs across multiple channels, including online ads, video campaigns, mobile, virtual events, and social media. This feature was mentioned in 42 Dynamics 365 Marketing reviews.

features.name: Event / Webinar Marketing
features.content: As reported in 42 Dynamics 365 Marketing reviews. Streamline the entire event process, including personalized invitations, registration, reminders, and post-event follow-up.  Integrate with online meeting tools like WebEx, Adobe Connect, GoToWebinar.

features.name: Calendaring
features.content: Based on 42 Dynamics 365 Marketing reviews. Maintain a marketing calendar across multiple groups. Manage the calendar for the entire marketing department, from promotions to content to PR.

features.name: Budgeting
features.content: Manage all aspects of marketing investments, including assigning top-down budgets to various groups and divisions, planning marketing spending across programs, tracking open-to-spend, ensuring budget compliance, coordinating work-flows and permissions, and reconciling plans with actual invoices. 40 reviewers of Dynamics 365 Marketing have provided feedback on this feature.

features.name: Social Listening
features.content: Monitor what leads and contacts say on sites such as Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, LinkedIn, blogs, and online communities.  Incorporate into your lead and customer DB and use social insights to segment prospects.  Trigger campaigns, and update lead scores. This feature was mentioned in 41 Dynamics 365 Marketing reviews.

features.name: Social Sharing
features.content: Add intelligent social share buttons to your campaigns and content.  Track who is sharing your content and driving conversions. 40 reviewers of Dynamics 365 Marketing have provided feedback on this feature.

features.name: Social Campaigns
features.content: Schedule automated posts to one or more social accounts; use or integrate with URL shortening services; and measure likes, comments, replies, and retweets. 42 reviewers of Dynamics 365 Marketing have provided feedback on this feature.

features.name: Social Media Engagement
features.content: Social apps including polls, sweepstakes, and referral programs can enhance audience engagement.  Include these on your website, landing pages, Facebook pages, and emails. This feature was mentioned in 42 Dynamics 365 Marketing reviews.

features.name: Social Media Advertising

features.name: Basic Reporting

Create report subscriptions that can automatically send updates to your team and executives.

features.name: Web Analytics
features.content: Track which pages prospects and customers visit and how often they come back.  Capture the history in database for lead scoring and sales intelligence. Send alerts to sales reps of which of their prospects and customers web activity. 40 reviewers of Dynamics 365 Marketing have provided feedback on this feature.

features.name: ROI Analytics

features.name: Revenue Analytics

Allocate pipeline and revenue credit among all the marketing activities that have successfully touched an opportunity as it moves through the pipeline.

features.name: SEO / Keyword Analytics

initial_reviews.review_title: My genuine review of Dynamics 365 Marketing
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dynamics 365 Marketing?
What is find most helpful about Dynamics 265 Marketing is its complete set oftools for managing marketing campaigns. I feel one of the upside of using Dynamics 365 Marketing is its seamless integration with other Microsoft softwares like Dynamics 365 sales.

What do you dislike about Dynamics 365 Marketing?
The least helpful feature about Dynamics 365 Marketing is itslearning curve, especially for users who have no or limited experience with similar marketing automation tools. One downside of using Dynamics 365 Marketing will be its occusional system slowdowns.

What problems is Dynamics 365 Marketing solving and how is that benefiting you?
Dynamics 365 Marketing helped us in streamlining and automating marketing processes, reducing manual efforts. The automation includes campaign creation, email marketing, lead nurturing, etc. Also, it helped us in tracking the performance of the marketing campaigns using it analytical tools.

initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dynamics 365 Marketing?
The deep connection with other Microsoft programs is what I like best about utilizing Dynamics 365 Marketing. The integration of Dynamics 365 Marketing with tools such as Microsoft 365 and Power BI creates a unified platform for marketing management. Furthermore, its emphasis on personalization and automation boosts advertising efficacy, providing a full and coherent experience.

What do you dislike about Dynamics 365 Marketing?
The part of Dynamics 365 Marketing that I dislike the most is the steep learning curve. Although the platform is powerful, it might be confusing for new users. The requirement for time to become thoroughly acquainted with all of the features could be an impediment. However, after this phase is complete, the platform's effectiveness compensates for the initial adaption period.

What problems is Dynamics 365 Marketing solving and how is that benefiting you?
I handle problems linked to the comprehensive management of marketing campaigns by using Dynamics 365 Marketing. Benefits include increased campaign personalization and automation efficiency, a comprehensive view of the client lifetime, and the ability to make informed decisions using advanced analytics. Integrating seamlessly with other Microsoft programs improves collaboration and consistency across the enterprise, enhancing operational effectiveness and customer happiness.

initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dynamics 365 Marketing?
Dynamics 365 Marketing is a customer engagement and marketing automation solution offered by Microsoft. Some aspects that users often appreciate about Dynamics 365 Marketing include:

Integration: It seamlessly integrates with other Microsoft Dynamics 365 applications, allowing for better data sharing and a more comprehensive view of customer interactions.

Automation: The platform offers robust marketing automation capabilities, enabling users to create and manage multi-channel marketing campaigns, including email, social media, webinars, events, and more.

Personalization: Dynamics 365 Marketing supports targeted and personalized communication, which is crucial for engaging customers effectively. It allows marketers to segment their audience and deliver tailored content and messages based on customer preferences and behaviours.

Lead Management: The solution helps manage leads throughout their lifecycle, from capturing them to nurturing and ultimately converting them into customers. It provides insights into lead behaviour and engagement to help optimize campaigns.

Analytics and Reporting: Users can track the performance of their marketing efforts through detailed analytics and reporting. This allows marketers to measure the success of campaigns, identify areas for improvement, and make data-driven decisions.

Event Management: The platform enables the planning and execution of both physical and virtual events, such as webinars and conferences. It offers tools for registration, attendee management, session scheduling, and post-event follow-up.

Social Media Integration: Dynamics 365 Marketing integrates with social media platforms, allowing users to manage and monitor their social media presence, engage with audiences, and analyze social media performance.

Customer Journey Mapping: Marketers can create and visualize customer journeys to understand how customers interact with their brands across different touchpoints. This helps in designing more effective and engaging campaigns.

Scalability: Dynamics 365 Marketing is designed to cater to businesses of varying sizes, from small businesses to large enterprises. It can scale as your organization grows and your marketing needs evolve.

What do you dislike about Dynamics 365 Marketing?
Complexity: Some users have found the platform to be complex and may require a learning curve, especially for those who are new to marketing automation tools or the Dynamics 365 ecosystem.

Customization: While Dynamics 365 Marketing offers a range of features, some users might find limitations in terms of customization options. Depending on specific business needs, there might be instances where certain customizations are not easily achievable.

Cost: Dynamics 365 Marketing is a premium solution, and the cost might be a concern for smaller businesses or organizations with tight budgets. The pricing structure might include licensing fees, implementation costs, and ongoing maintenance expenses.

Integration Challenges: While Dynamics 365 Marketing is designed to integrate well with other Microsoft applications, users might face integration challenges when trying to connect with third-party tools or platforms outside of the Microsoft ecosystem.

Technical Requirements: Setting up and maintaining Dynamics 365 Marketing might require dedicated IT resources, which could be a challenge for smaller businesses with limited technical support.

Performance: Some users have reported instances of performance issues or delays, particularly when dealing with larger datasets or complex marketing campaigns.

Dependence on Microsoft Ecosystem: While the integration with other Microsoft tools can be beneficial, it can also be limiting if your organization prefers or relies heavily on non-Microsoft solutions.

User Interface: While Dynamics 365 Marketing has seen improvements in its user interface over time, some users might still find certain aspects of the interface less intuitive or clunky compared to other marketing automation tools.

What problems is Dynamics 365 Marketing solving and how is that benefiting you?
Lack of Automation: Dynamics 365 Marketing helps businesses automate their marketing processes, from lead generation and nurturing to campaign execution. This saves time and effort by streamlining repetitive tasks and allowing marketers to focus on more strategic activities.

Fragmented Data: Many businesses struggle with fragmented customer data spread across various systems. Dynamics 365 Marketing centralizes customer data, providing a holistic view of customer interactions and enabling more personalized and targeted marketing campaigns.

Ineffective Campaigns: Without proper tools, creating and managing marketing campaigns can be challenging. Dynamics 365 Marketing offers campaign planning, execution, and analysis features that improve the effectiveness of marketing efforts by providing insights into what works and what doesn't.

Poor Lead Management: Businesses often struggle with managing leads effectively. Dynamics 365 Marketing provides tools to capture, nurture, and qualify leads, ensuring a more structured and efficient lead management process.

Lack of Personalization: Generic marketing messages can result in lower engagement. Dynamics 365 Marketing enables businesses to segment their audience, tailor messages to individual preferences, and deliver personalized experiences across different channels.

Limited Insights: Making data-driven decisions is crucial in marketing. Dynamics 365 Marketing offers robust analytics and reporting capabilities that provide insights into campaign performance, customer behavior, and ROI, allowing businesses to refine their strategies.

Event Management Challenges: Planning and executing events can be complex. Dynamics 365 Marketing helps businesses manage events, from registration and promotion to post-event follow-up, enhancing attendee experiences and engagement.

Manual Social Media Management: Keeping up with social media interactions manually is time-consuming. Dynamics 365 Marketing integrates with social media platforms, allowing businesses to manage and analyze social interactions from within the platform.

Lack of Customer Journey Understanding: Understanding customer journeys is essential for effective marketing. Dynamics 365 Marketing assists in visualizing and optimizing customer journeys, leading to better engagement and conversions.

Scalability and Growth: As businesses grow, managing marketing activities across different channels becomes more challenging. Dynamics 365 Marketing scales to accommodate growing marketing needs and provides tools to manage larger customer bases.

Fragmented Data: Many businesses struggle with fragmented customer data spread across various systems. Dynamics 365 Marketing centralizes customer data, providing a holistic view of customer interactions and enabling more personalized and targeted marketing campaigns.

Ineffective Campaigns: Without proper tools, creating and managing marketing campaigns can be challenging. Dynamics 365 Marketing offers campaign planning, execution, and analysis features that improve the effectiveness of marketing efforts by providing insights into what works and what doesn't.

Poor Lead Management: Businesses often struggle with managing leads effectively. Dynamics 365 Marketing provides tools to capture, nurture, and qualify leads, ensuring a more structured and efficient lead management process.

Lack of Personalization: Generic marketing messages can result in lower engagement. Dynamics 365 Marketing enables businesses to segment their audience, tailor messages to individual preferences, and deliver personalized experiences across different channels.

Limited Insights: Making data-driven decisions is crucial in marketing. Dynamics 365 Marketing offers robust analytics and reporting capabilities that provide insights into campaign performance, customer behavior, and ROI, allowing businesses to refine their strategies.

Event Management Challenges: Planning and executing events can be complex. Dynamics 365 Marketing helps businesses manage events, from registration and promotion to post-event follow-up, enhancing attendee experiences and engagement.

Manual Social Media Management: Keeping up with social media interactions manually is time-consuming. Dynamics 365 Marketing integrates with social media platforms, allowing businesses to manage and analyze social interactions from within the platform.

Lack of Customer Journey Understanding: Understanding customer journeys is essential for effective marketing. Dynamics 365 Marketing assists in visualizing and optimizing customer journeys, leading to better engagement and conversions.

Scalability and Growth: As businesses grow, managing marketing activities across different channels becomes more challenging. Dynamics 365 Marketing scales to accommodate growing marketing needs and provides tools to manage larger customer bases.

initial_reviews.review_title: Best Software for Marketing and Customer Insights
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dynamics 365 Marketing?
Features which I loved :

1. Unified customer view
2. Marketing automation
3. Personalization
4. Reporting and analytics


Few things which I really liked about this software :

1.It is a cloud-based platform, so you can access it from anywhere.
2. It is easy to use, even for non-technical users.
3. It is scalable, so you can grow your business without having to change
your marketing platform.
4. It is secure, so you can be confident that your customer data is safe.
5. It is affordable, so it is a good option for businesses of all sizes.

What do you dislike about Dynamics 365 Marketing?
Some of the downsides which I came across:

- The platform it bit slow and unresponsive at times.
- The reporting features are not as robust as some of the competition.
- There is limited support for third-party integrations.

There is a steep learning curve, and it takes some time to get up to speed on all of the features and functionality of the software. Could have been made little more user friendly.

What problems is Dynamics 365 Marketing solving and how is that benefiting you?
It is helping me with -
1. Email marketing
2. Landing pages
3. Marketing automation
4. Social media marketing
5. Website personalization
6. Marketing analytics

Ultimately, it has helped me in generating leads and increasing the customer engagement.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dynamics 365 Marketing?
Dynamics 365 Marketing is a customer engagement and marketing automation solution offered by Microsoft. Some aspects that users often appreciate about Dynamics 365 Marketing include:

Integration: It seamlessly integrates with other Microsoft Dynamics 365 applications, allowing for better data sharing and a more comprehensive view of customer interactions.

Automation: The platform offers robust marketing automation capabilities, enabling users to create and manage multi-channel marketing campaigns, including email, social media, webinars, events, and more.

Personalization: Dynamics 365 Marketing supports targeted and personalized communication, which is crucial for engaging customers effectively. It allows marketers to segment their audience and deliver tailored content and messages based on customer preferences and behaviours.

Lead Management: The solution helps manage leads throughout their lifecycle, from capturing them to nurturing and ultimately converting them into customers. It provides insights into lead behaviour and engagement to help optimize campaigns.

Analytics and Reporting: Users can track the performance of their marketing efforts through detailed analytics and reporting. This allows marketers to measure the success of campaigns, identify areas for improvement, and make data-driven decisions.

Event Management: The platform enables the planning and execution of both physical and virtual events, such as webinars and conferences. It offers tools for registration, attendee management, session scheduling, and post-event follow-up.

Social Media Integration: Dynamics 365 Marketing integrates with social media platforms, allowing users to manage and monitor their social media presence, engage with audiences, and analyze social media performance.

Customer Journey Mapping: Marketers can create and visualize customer journeys to understand how customers interact with their brands across different touchpoints. This helps in designing more effective and engaging campaigns.

Scalability: Dynamics 365 Marketing is designed to cater to businesses of varying sizes, from small businesses to large enterprises. It can scale as your organization grows and your marketing needs evolve.

What do you dislike about Dynamics 365 Marketing?
Complexity: Some users have found the platform to be complex and may require a learning curve, especially for those who are new to marketing automation tools or the Dynamics 365 ecosystem.

Customization: While Dynamics 365 Marketing offers a range of features, some users might find limitations in terms of customization options. Depending on specific business needs, there might be instances where certain customizations are not easily achievable.

Cost: Dynamics 365 Marketing is a premium solution, and the cost might be a concern for smaller businesses or organizations with tight budgets. The pricing structure might include licensing fees, implementation costs, and ongoing maintenance expenses.

Integration Challenges: While Dynamics 365 Marketing is designed to integrate well with other Microsoft applications, users might face integration challenges when trying to connect with third-party tools or platforms outside of the Microsoft ecosystem.

Technical Requirements: Setting up and maintaining Dynamics 365 Marketing might require dedicated IT resources, which could be a challenge for smaller businesses with limited technical support.

Performance: Some users have reported instances of performance issues or delays, particularly when dealing with larger datasets or complex marketing campaigns.

Dependence on Microsoft Ecosystem: While the integration with other Microsoft tools can be beneficial, it can also be limiting if your organization prefers or relies heavily on non-Microsoft solutions.

User Interface: While Dynamics 365 Marketing has seen improvements in its user interface over time, some users might still find certain aspects of the interface less intuitive or clunky compared to other marketing automation tools.

What problems is Dynamics 365 Marketing solving and how is that benefiting you?
Lack of Automation: Dynamics 365 Marketing helps businesses automate their marketing processes, from lead generation and nurturing to campaign execution. This saves time and effort by streamlining repetitive tasks and allowing marketers to focus on more strategic activities.

Fragmented Data: Many businesses struggle with fragmented customer data spread across various systems. Dynamics 365 Marketing centralizes customer data, providing a holistic view of customer interactions and enabling more personalized and targeted marketing campaigns.

Ineffective Campaigns: Without proper tools, creating and managing marketing campaigns can be challenging. Dynamics 365 Marketing offers campaign planning, execution, and analysis features that improve the effectiveness of marketing efforts by providing insights into what works and what doesn't.

Poor Lead Management: Businesses often struggle with managing leads effectively. Dynamics 365 Marketing provides tools to capture, nurture, and qualify leads, ensuring a more structured and efficient lead management process.

Lack of Personalization: Generic marketing messages can result in lower engagement. Dynamics 365 Marketing enables businesses to segment their audience, tailor messages to individual preferences, and deliver personalized experiences across different channels.

Limited Insights: Making data-driven decisions is crucial in marketing. Dynamics 365 Marketing offers robust analytics and reporting capabilities that provide insights into campaign performance, customer behavior, and ROI, allowing businesses to refine their strategies.

Event Management Challenges: Planning and executing events can be complex. Dynamics 365 Marketing helps businesses manage events, from registration and promotion to post-event follow-up, enhancing attendee experiences and engagement.

Manual Social Media Management: Keeping up with social media interactions manually is time-consuming. Dynamics 365 Marketing integrates with social media platforms, allowing businesses to manage and analyze social interactions from within the platform.

Lack of Customer Journey Understanding: Understanding customer journeys is essential for effective marketing. Dynamics 365 Marketing assists in visualizing and optimizing customer journeys, leading to better engagement and conversions.

Scalability and Growth: As businesses grow, managing marketing activities across different channels becomes more challenging. Dynamics 365 Marketing scales to accommodate growing marketing needs and provides tools to manage larger customer bases.

all_reviews.review_title: Best Software for Marketing and Customer Insights
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dynamics 365 Marketing?
Features which I loved :

1. Unified customer view
2. Marketing automation
3. Personalization
4. Reporting and analytics


Few things which I really liked about this software :

1.It is a cloud-based platform, so you can access it from anywhere.
2. It is easy to use, even for non-technical users.
3. It is scalable, so you can grow your business without having to change
your marketing platform.
4. It is secure, so you can be confident that your customer data is safe.
5. It is affordable, so it is a good option for businesses of all sizes.

What do you dislike about Dynamics 365 Marketing?
Some of the downsides which I came across:

- The platform it bit slow and unresponsive at times.
- The reporting features are not as robust as some of the competition.
- There is limited support for third-party integrations.

There is a steep learning curve, and it takes some time to get up to speed on all of the features and functionality of the software. Could have been made little more user friendly.

What problems is Dynamics 365 Marketing solving and how is that benefiting you?
It is helping me with -
1. Email marketing
2. Landing pages
3. Marketing automation
4. Social media marketing
5. Website personalization
6. Marketing analytics

Ultimately, it has helped me in generating leads and increasing the customer engagement.

What do you dislike about Dynamics 365 Marketing?
It is pretty much non-intuitive and really takes a lot of research and tutorials and reaching out to others to get your bearings. Compared to software like Netsuite some "simple" processes are almost impossible to figure out without help.

Recommendations to others considering Dynamics 365 Marketing:
Make sure you have a good resource for your team to learn all the ins and outs of this software. Without proper guidance, a lot of company time can be wasted trying to figure things out by trial and error and there are a lot of different ways to execute tasks.

What problems is Dynamics 365 Marketing solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer Journeys, CRM, Email Marketing and lead form generation.

all_reviews.review_title: An all in one, understand my need and the need of our company.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dynamics 365 Marketing?
This tool allows the integration of various applications, which gives us the solution of not having more than 6 windows open on our PCs, which allows us to have a greater organization and optimal performance of our efforts in our Call Center BPO company.
It also allows the integration of office tools.

What do you dislike about Dynamics 365 Marketing?
It is not that I do not like it, the issue is how complex it can become to use artificial intelligence technology, so we have not yet put it into practice and we are losing its usefulness.

Recommendations to others considering Dynamics 365 Marketing:
I recommend it YES, the utility it has is 100% if you learn to compile the needs of your company. focus your need and you will see the solution that will give you

practically our management area is located in Call so that all the time you decrease, it is to generate an optimization, also the quality of our responses are improving
